Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.view.base

Class FormHelper

java.lang.Object
it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.view.base.FormHelper
public final class FormHelper extends Object
Instantiable helper for form handling (no statics).

Keeps a reference to an AlertHelper to report validation errors and exposes tiny utilities for reading and validating text fields. Intentionally small and boring by desing; controllers can new it up and reuse.

Example


 FormHelper fh = new FormHelper(new AlertHelper());
 String desc = fh.safe(descriptionField);
 Double amt  = fh.amountOrAlert(amountField);
 amountField.setTextFormatter(fh.amount2Dec());

    • FormHelper

      public FormHelper(AlertHelper alerts)
      Creates a new helper bound to the given AlertHelper.

  • Method Details

    • safe

      public String safe(javafx.scene.control.TextField tf)
      Returns the text content of a TextField, trimmed and never null.

      If the control returns null, this method yields an empty string. Handy to avoid repetitive null checks in controllers.

      Parameters:
      tf - the text field to read
      Returns:
      trimmed text (possibly "")

    • amountOrAlert

      public Double amountOrAlert(javafx.scene.control.TextField tf)
      Parses a monetary amount from a TextField using a dot as the decimal separator.

      Accepts only the '.' as decimal point (locale-agnostic). If parsing fails (including blank input), an error dialog is shown via AlertHelper and this method returns null. Callers should check for null before proceeding.

      Parameters:
      tf - the text field containing the amount
      Returns:
      the parsed Double, or null if invalid

    • amount2Dec

      public javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter<String> amount2Dec()
      Returns a TextFormatter that allows optional sign and up to two decimal places.

      Pattern: ^-?[0-9]*([\\.][0-9]{0,2})?$. Useful to prevent users from entering invalid characters in the first place. This is a light guard; business rules should still validate values later (trust, but verify â€” or viceversa).

      Returns:
      a text formatter suitable for amount fields
